snippet: In an unusual case, the government claimed a drug-laden speedboat seized near Costa Rica and Nicaragua was subject to United States jurisdiction because it wasn’t “flying its nation’s ensign or flag.”
abstract: Federal Judge Jed S Rakoff rules Ecuadorean flag decal on drug-laden speedboat sunk by United States Coast Guard off coast of Costa Rica and Nicaragua was small enough that boat was stateless under law; case revolved around what it means to fly a nation's ensign or flag.
lead_paragraph: In an unusual case, the government claimed a drug-laden speedboat seized near Costa Rica and Nicaragua was subject to United States jurisdiction because it wasn’t “flying its nation’s ensign or flag.”

headline.print_headline: Fast Boat, Tiny Flag: Government’s High-Flying Rationale for a Drug Seizure
